availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Staton and Mary Staton. Married to Mary Elizabeth Hedrick Staton in Bath County on November 19, 1857. Father of Luther Staton, Sarah A. Staton, and Eunice L. Staton. Laborer in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 29B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 236.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 100A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, 1811-1862, Film #000273007, p. 82 of 700 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
